cooking_method: Mix all ingredients (except buns) in a slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Shred the pork with a fork and serve on buns with additional BBQ sauce.
Mix all ingredients (except buns) in a slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Shred the pork with a fork and serve on buns with additional BBQ sauce.
Mix all ingredients (except buns) in a slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours. Shred the pork with a fork and serve on buns with additional BBQ sauce.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Mix ground beef with salt and pepper and form into 4 patties. Grill burgers for 4-5 minutes per side, adding cheese in the last minute of cooking. Toast buns on the grill. Assemble burgers with ketchup, mayonnaise, onion, lettuce, and tomato.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Mix ground beef with salt and pepper and form into 4 patties. Grill burgers for 4-5 minutes per side, adding cheese in the last minute of cooking. Toast buns on the grill. Assemble burgers with ketchup, mayonnaise, onion, lettuce, and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Gradually whisk in milk and cook until mixture thickens, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in cheese, salt, and pepper until cheese is melted. Add cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and mix well. Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish and sprinkle breadcrumbs on top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

1. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. 2. In a bowl, mix together the ground beef, salt, and pepper. Divide the mixture into four equal portions and form each into a patty. 3. Grill the patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness. 4. During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on each patty and allow it to melt. 5. Toast the hamburger buns on the grill for about 30 seconds. 6. Assemble the burgers with your desired toppings and serve.

1. Soak the chicken pieces in buttermilk for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. 2. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and black pepper. 3. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk and dredge each piece in the flour mixture, making sure to coat it well. 4. Heat about 2 inches of vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. 5. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the chicken pieces to the pot in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pot. 6. Fry the chicken for about 10-12 minutes per side, or until the coating is crispy and golden brown and the chicken is cooked through. 7. Remove the chicken from the pot and let it drain on a paper towel-lined plate. 8. Serve hot.

1. Preheat your oven to 500°F. 2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled pizza pan or baking sheet. 4. Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges. 5. Arrange the mozzarella slices on top of the sauce. 6. Sprinkle the grated Parmesan cheese over the top. 7. Drizzle the olive oil over the pizza, then sprinkle with the red pepper flakes. 8. Bake the pizza for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly. 9. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
